document_type: Final Determination Notification and Payroll Records
security: The document is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponed release of certain information within HSCA staff payroll records, specifically Social Security numbers, due to privacy concerns.
summary_one_paragraph: The Assassination Records Review Board issued a final determination notification on December 8, 1995, concerning HSCA staff payroll records. The decision involved postponing the release of specific information, identified as Social Security numbers, because the Review Board determined public disclosure would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, outweighing public interest. The document indicates that there have been two postponements related to this record, with a date of next review set for 2017, and the board review was completed on October 24, 1995.
tags: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act
title: Final Determination Notification: HSCA Staff Payroll Records
